title: Milk Link
text:
Milk Link is a large <a href="dairy">dairy</a> company in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>. It is the UK's largest dairy <a href="cooperative">cooperative</a> and the UK's largest producer of <a href="cheese">cheese</a>. In 2012 the company merged with <a href="Arla%20Foods">Arla Foods</a>.
History.
It was formed in April 2000 as one of three successor co-operatives to <a href="Milk%20Marque">Milk Marque</a>. Milk Marque was broken up after the <a href="Competition%20Commission%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Competition Commission</a> queried how it set milk prices.
In July 2002, the company bought the <a href="Crediton">Crediton</a> and <a href="Kirkcudbright">Kirkcudbright</a> creameries from <a href="Express%20Dairies">Express Dairies</a> for £33.1 million, which both make <a href="Ultra-high-temperature%20processing">UHT milk</a>. It also bought out the 50% of joint-venture partner Express Dairies in the creamery at <a href="Frome">Frome</a>. As noted below, the Crediton operations were later sold in a management buyout.
In February 2004 it set up The Cheese Company with <a href="Kilkenny">Kilkenny</a>-based <a href="Glanbia">Glanbia</a>, which had four cheese production sites and a packing facility supplying major retailers in the UK, in which it took a 75% stake. In December 2006 it bought out Glanbia for £47.2 million.
In July 2005 it closed a site at <a href="Sible%20Hedingham">Sible Hedingham</a>.
From October 2007 to February 2008 there were talks to merge with <a href="First%20Milk%20%28company%29">First Milk</a>.
In August 2011 it split into two divisions named 'Milk Link, Cheese' and 'Milk Link, Milk'.
In September 2011 it announced that it would increase the size of the <a href="Lockerbie">Lockerbie</a> creamery by 50% to produce 37,000 tonnes of cheese a year, into a UK market which consumes 600,000 tonnes of cheese a year.
In 2012 the company merged with Arla Foods.
Products.
Each year it handles around 1.5 billion litres of milk.
It makes the chocolate-flavoured milk under licence for the "<a href="Mars%20%28chocolate%20bar%29">Mars</a>" and "<a href="Galaxy%20%28chocolate%29">Galaxy</a>" brand.
Cheeses.
It exports cheese to 19 countries.
